Package spring.ecommerce.controller

Class ProductController

java.lang.Object
spring.ecommerce.controller.ProductController
@CrossOrigin(origins="http://localhost:4200") @RestController @RequestMapping("/api/v1/products") public class ProductController extends Object
Controller for managing product-related operations.

  • Method Details

    • addNewProduct

      @PostMapping(value="/product", consumes="multipart/form-data") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> addNewProduct(@RequestPart("product") @Valid @Valid ProductEntity product, @RequestPart(value="imageFile",required=false) org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile[] files)
      Creates a new product and optionally associates images with it.

      This method receives a ProductEntity object and a list of image files, validates them, and associates the images with the product. It then calls the productService#addNewProduct(ProductEntity, MultipartFile[]) method to save the product in the database. If the product and images are successfully created, it returns a ResponseEntity with the created product and a HttpStatus.CREATED status. If an error occurs during the process, an error message is logged, and a ResponseEntity with an HttpStatus.INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR status is returned.

      Parameters:
      product - the ProductEntity object to be created, including details such as name, description, price, etc.
      files - an array of MultipartFile objects representing images to be associated with the product. This parameter is optional.
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the created ProductEntity object if successful, or an error response if an exception occurs.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs while creating the product or uploading the images.

    • updateProduct

      @PutMapping(value="/product/{productId}", consumes="multipart/form-data") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> updateProduct(@RequestPart("product") @Valid @Valid ProductEntity product, @PathVariable("productId") Integer productId, @RequestPart(value="imageFile",required=false) List<org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile> newImages, @RequestPart(value="existingImages",required=false) List<String> existingImages)
      Updates an existing product and its associated images.

      This method receives a ProductEntity object and updates the product with the specified productId. It can also update the associated images by receiving new images and/or the IDs of existing images that need to be retained. The method calls the productService#updateProduct(Integer, ProductEntity, List, List) to perform the update operation. If the product is successfully updated, a success message is returned with a HttpStatus.OK status. If any error occurs during the process, an error message is returned with a HttpStatus.BAD_REQUEST status.

      Parameters:
      product - the ProductEntity object containing the updated product details.
      productId - the ID of the product to be updated.
      newImages - a list of MultipartFile objects representing new images to be associated with the product (optional).
      existingImages - a list of image names or IDs of existing images to be retained (optional).
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing a success message if the product is updated successfully, or an error message if an exception occurs.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs while updating the product or its images.

    • getAllProducts

      @GetMapping("/all") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getAllProducts()
      Retrieves a list of all products.

      This method attempts to fetch all products from the database. If the operation is successful, it returns the list of products with an HTTP 200 OK status. If an error occurs during the process, it logs the error and returns an HTTP 500 Internal Server Error response.

      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the list of all products if successful, or an error response with an HTTP 500 status if an error occurs.

    • getAllProductsOrderedByNameWithPagination

      @GetMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getAllProductsOrderedByNameWithPagination(@RequestParam(defaultValue="0") int page, @RequestParam(defaultValue="10") int size, @RequestParam(defaultValue="") String searchKey)
      Retrieves a paginated list of products ordered by their name. This method fetches a list of products from the service, ordered by the product name, and returns the result as a paginated response. It takes in the page number and the size of the page as query parameters. The default page is 0, and the default page size is 10.
      Parameters:
      page - The page number to retrieve. Defaults to 0 if not provided.
      size - The number of products per page. Defaults to 10 if not provided.
      the - search key.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a paginated list of products, or an internal server error if an exception occurs during the retrieval.

    • getProductDetails

      @GetMapping("/getProductDetails") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getProductDetails(@RequestParam boolean isSingleProductCheckout, @RequestParam Integer productId)
      Retrieves the details of a product based on the provided product ID and checkout type.
      Parameters:
      isSingleProductCheckout - A boolean flag indicating whether the checkout is for a single product.
      productId - The ID of the product whose details are to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing the product details, or an error response in case of failure.

    • getProduct

      @GetMapping("/product/{productId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ProductEntity> getProduct(@PathVariable("productId") Integer productId)
      Retrieves a product by its ID.

      This method attempts to fetch a product from the database using the provided product ID. If the product is found, it returns the product with an HTTP 200 OK status. If the product is not found, it returns an HTTP 404 Not Found response.

      Parameters:
      productId - the ID of the product to be retrieved
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the ProductEntity if found, or an HTTP 404 Not Found status if the product is not found

    • deleteProduct

      @DeleteMapping("/product/{productId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deleteProduct(@PathVariable(name="productId") Integer productId)
      Deletes a product by its ID.

      This method attempts to delete a product from the database using the provided product ID. If the deletion is successful, it returns an HTTP 204 No Content status. If an error occurs during the deletion process, it logs the error and returns an HTTP 500 Internal Server Error response.

      Parameters:
      productId - the ID of the product to be deleted
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity with an HTTP 204 No Content status if the product is deleted successfully, or an HTTP 500 Internal Server Error status if an error occurs

    • generateProductListPdf

      @GetMapping("/pdf") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<byte[]> generateProductListPdf()
      Generates a PDF document containing a list of all products ordered by name. This method retrieves all products from the database, orders them by name, and generates a PDF file that includes the list of products. The PDF is generated without pagination. The file is then returned as a downloadable response with the appropriate headers for a PDF file.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity<byte[]> A response entity containing the PDF file in byte array format along with the necessary headers for download. If an error occurs during the PDF generation, an internal server error response is returned.

    • downloadProductListCsv

      @GetMapping("/csv") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<byte[]> downloadProductListCsv()
      Endpoint to generate and download a CSV file containing all products.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing the CSV file as a byte array. The response will include appropriate headers for file download.

    • downloadProductListExcel

      @GetMapping("/excel") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<byte[]> downloadProductListExcel()
      Handles the request to download the product list as an Excel file. This method generates an Excel file containing product details and sends it as a downloadable response to the client.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing the generated Excel file as a byte array, or an HTTP 500 Internal Server Error if there was an issue during file generation.

    • uploadImage

      public Set<ImageEntity> uploadImage(org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile[] multipartFiles)
      Uploads and processes multiple image files, returning a set of ImageEntity objects.

      This method receives an array of MultipartFile objects representing image files to be uploaded. It checks each file for size and processes it to create ImageEntity objects. If any file exceeds the maximum allowed size, it logs a warning and skips that file. If there is an error while processing a file, it logs an error and skips the file. The method returns a Set containing all successfully processed ImageEntity objects.

      Parameters:
      multipartFiles - an array of MultipartFile objects representing the image files to be uploaded.
      Returns:
      a Set containing the successfully uploaded and processed ImageEntity objects. If no files are uploaded or processed, an empty set is returned.

    • importProducts

      @PostMapping("/import-products") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<ProductEntity>> importProducts(@RequestParam("file") org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile file)
      Imports products from an Excel file and saves them in the database. This method processes the uploaded file, extracts product information, and returns the list of imported products.
      Parameters:
      file - The MultipartFile representing the uploaded Excel file.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a list of ProductEntity objects if the import is successful, or a 500 Internal Server Error status if an exception occurs.
